criteria: Accuracy of Information Identification: How accurately the student identifies key nutrition information (serving size, calories, fats, carbohydrates, protein, vitamins, minerals) on food labels.
Ability to Compare Products: Demonstrates the ability to use nutrition information to compare two or more food products.
Understanding of Nutritional Value: Understanding and articulation of the nutritional value of the information presented (e.g., recognizing high vs. low values for different nutrients).
descriptions: Fails to identify any nutrition information on food labels.
Identifies only one or two components of nutrition information with inaccuracies.
Identifies some nutrition information, but with several inaccuracies or omissions.
Identifies most of the nutrition information with minor inaccuracies.
Accurately identifies all key nutrition information with only minor errors.
Accurately and comprehensively identifies all key nutrition information on food labels.
Unable to compare products using nutrition information.
Attempts to compare products but provides irrelevant or inaccurate comparisons.
Compares products but misses key differences in nutrition information.
Compares products using some nutrition information, but the comparison lacks depth.
Effectively compares products using most of the relevant nutrition information.
Demonstrates a comprehensive comparison of products using all relevant nutrition information to make informed decisions.
Shows no understanding of the nutritional value of the information.
Demonstrates very limited understanding of nutritional value.
Shows some understanding of nutritional value but struggles to interpret the information.
Understands nutritional value but provides superficial interpretations.
Demonstrates a good understanding of nutritional value and provides clear interpretations.
Exhibits a deep understanding of nutritional value, offering insightful and nuanced interpretations.
